headline: SOVRN NAMES JUD VALESKI CHIEF TECHNOLOGY OFFICER
summary: Sovrn, a data and technology platform that helps content creators earn and keep more of their revenue, today announced that it has named Jud Valeski as Chief Technology Officer. Valeski, who will oversee the company's data science, engineering and technology capabilities, will be based out of Sovrn's Boulder office and will report directly to Walter Knapp, CEO.

headline: Can PayPal Make a Turnaround With Its Buy Now, Pay Later Platform?
summary: PayPal bets big on BNPL as Q1 growth tops 20%, aiming to drive global adoption and deeper user engagement through AI and checkout upgrades.

headline: What Does 13% YTD Drop Mean for PayPal Stock? Buy, Hold or Sell?
summary: PayPal stock is lagging rivals in 2025, but strong BNPL gains and global expansion hint at potential upside ahead.

headline: Wall Street Analysts Dish Out Circle Stock Ratings, Ponder Rise Of Stablecoins
summary: Circle stock has climbed nearly 500% since the company's IPO, though shares have retreated from a high of 248.88 set on June 20.

headline: Trust Stamp Partners with Neural Payments to Bring Innovative ID Security to the $3.2 Trillion P2P Payment Sector
summary: With 8% of all banking customers saying they’ve been victimized by a P2P scam in the last 12 months, Trust Stamp and Neural Payments partner to decrease the risk of fraud and make banks and their customers more secure Atlanta, GA, June 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Trust Stamp (Nasdaq: IDAI) today announced a partnership with Neural Payments for the integration of Trust Stamp’s low-code Orchestration Platform. Neural Payments provides banks and credit unions with real-time person-to-person (P2P)

headline: Digital Payment Today - Cashless Revolution: Prepaid Cards Drive Market Growth
summary: The U.S. prepaid card and digital wallet market is experiencing significant growth, driven by an increasing preference for cashless transactions, the rise of e-commerce, and innovations in closed-loop prepaid cards. Projected to expand by 11% annually to $749.46 billion by 2025, the market benefits from a mix of consumer demand and institutional initiatives, including government disbursements and financial inclusion efforts. As regulatory frameworks evolve and competition intensifies among...
